scenario_name: Project Aurora – AI‑Powered Search Optimization Squad Mission
company_context: Microsoft Azure AI division, Cloud Search product team. The squad is part of the Azure Cognitive Search group, tasked with integrating a new large‑language‑model (LLM) based relevance engine into the existing search service. The team follows the MMM (Mission‑Milestone‑Metric) framework and operates as a cross‑functional, autonomous squad of 7 members.
meeting_event_details: 2025-12-02, 10:00 AM – 11:00 AM PST, 60‑minute virtual kickoff via Microsoft Teams (Meeting ID: 274 819 562). All squad members and key stakeholders are required to attend.
stakeholders: Priya Patel – Directly Responsible Individual (DRI), Senior Product Manager – owns mission success, defines scope, and prioritizes backlog.
Liam O'Connor – Engineering Lead, Senior Software Engineer – responsible for architecture, code quality, and delivery of the LLM inference service.
Aisha Rahman – UX Lead, Interaction Designer – designs UI/UX for the new relevance controls and admin dashboards.
Dr. Chen Wu – Data Science Lead, Principal Data Scientist – builds and validates the LLM relevance model, defines evaluation metrics.
Ravi Kumar – Security & Compliance Engineer – ensures the solution meets Azure security baselines and GDPR/CCPA requirements.
Megan Liu – Marketing & Go‑to‑Market Manager – creates launch messaging, beta program plan, and adoption tracking.
Jenna Torres – Program Manager, Azure Cloud Infra – coordinates dependencies on compute quota, networking, and storage provisioning.
deliverables: Mission Charter (incl. scope, success metrics, risk register) – due T+2 weeks.
Technical Architecture Document and API spec for the LLM relevance service – due T+2 weeks.
High‑fidelity UI mockups and interaction flow for relevance controls – due T+4 weeks.
Prototype LLM model trained on Azure Search logs with baseline relevance score – due T+4 weeks.
Beta‑ready integrated service (CI/CD pipeline, automated tests, security hardening) deployed to Azure staging – due T+6 weeks.
Beta program plan, pilot customer list, and success measurement framework – due T+6 weeks.
General Availability (GA) release package: code, documentation, rollout checklist, and post‑launch monitoring dashboard – due T+8 weeks.
success_criteria: Achieve ≥20 % reduction in average query latency for relevance‑enhanced searches in the beta environment.
Increase relevance‑score (NDCG@10) by ≥15 % compared with the existing BM25 baseline on a held‑out test set.
Onboard at least 5 strategic enterprise customers into the beta program within 2 weeks of beta launch.
Maintain 99.9 % availability of the LLM inference endpoint during the beta period.
Pass all Azure security compliance scans (Microsoft Secure Development Lifecycle) with zero critical findings.
Deliver GA on schedule (T+8 weeks) within the allocated $250k budget.
Post‑launch adoption: ≥30 % of Azure Search customers enable the new relevance feature within 30 days of GA.
constraints: Total budget capped at $250,000 (includes cloud compute, third‑party model licensing, and contractor UX work).
Compute quota for GPU‑accelerated VMs must be secured from the Cloud Infra team by T+1 week.
All data used for model training must be anonymized and stored in a compliant Azure Blob container (RG‑azsearch‑ml).
Dependency on the Azure Identity team for token‑based authentication integration – delivery expected by T+3 weeks.
Legal review of the external model licensing agreement must be completed before any production deployment (deadline T+5 weeks).
Team members are allocated 75 % of their time to this mission; other commitments must not exceed 25 %.
workback_prompt: Generate a detailed 8‑week workback plan for the 'Project Aurora – AI‑Powered Search Optimization' squad mission. Include bi‑weekly milestones, owners, required inputs/outputs for each milestone, risk mitigation actions, and a timeline view. Align each deliverable and success metric with the mission charter, and reference the constraints (budget, compute quota, legal review, and cross‑team dependencies). Use the MMM framework (Mission, Milestone, Metric) to structure the plan and provide a concise executive summary for senior leadership.
